intro: Henriettea tobagensis, commonly known as the Tobago starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Tobago. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other species such as evening primroses and willowherbs. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped, brightly colored flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. Henriettea tobagensis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and forest edges. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
